note.p: Education: Trinity College, Dublin. BA (1714); MA (1717); LLD (1722)

Career: Travelled in Italy and France; Bishop of Killala and Achonry (1729-1730); Bishop of Cork and Ross (1735); Bishop of Clogher (1745); accused of Arianism (1752) and threatened with prosecution for heresy (1757); published sermons and theological works
